intro: Astragalus przhevalskianus, commonly known as the Pallas' milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in steppes and rocky soils. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens.
